questions.question: What are the examples for operating systems
questions.answer: Microsoft Windows, Linux, Ubuntu, Mac OS

questions.question: What are the common features of an operating system
questions.answer: Memory management, File handling, Security management, Disk space management, Task management

questions.question: What are the different types of file attributes
questions.answer: System, Read only, Hidden, Archive

questions.question: How to manage files in an Operating System
questions.answer: By grouping them inside the folders.

questions.question: What is the different between file and folder
questions.answer: File is a single document, Folder can hold collection of files/documents.

questions.question: What is the meaning of open-source software
questions.answer: Open-source softwares are freely available to use and it's source (source code) is freely available for users.

questions.question: What is the meaning of closed-source software
questions.answer: Closed-sourced software which has an owner, without a permission it does not available freely.

questions.question: What is the meaning of file compression
questions.answer: Reduce the file size by using a file compression software.

questions.question: What are the examples for file compression softwares
questions.answer: WinZip, WinRAR, 7zip

questions.question: What is the meaning of system restore
questions.answer: System Restore is a feature in Microsoft Windows that allows the user to revert their computer's state to that of a previous point in time, which can be used to recover from system malfunctions or other problems.

questions.question: What is the meaning of computer virus
questions.answer: It is a specific computer program which makes harmful activities or malfunctioning in a computer.

questions.question: What is anti-virus software/virus guard
questions.answer: It is a software which created to protect computer from harmful programs.

questions.question: What are the examples for ant-virus softwares
questions.answer: Avast, Kaspersky, Avira, AVG, BitDefender, Norton

questions.question: How to recognize virus infection in a computer
questions.answer: Slow down computer, Unexpected computer restarting, Malfunctioning softwares, Unexpected hard disk filling, CPU over heating, System crashes

questions.question: How to avoid from computer viruses
questions.answer: Use proper anti-virus software and make sure to update it, Avoid from unsure pen drive or software installing, Avoid from clicking spam emails or spam links, Make sure to install legitimate softwares rather than installing pirate or cracked softwares, Make sure to backup your important data

questions.question: What is word processing
questions.answer: Creating documents or letters by using a word processing software

questions.question: What is the meaning of word processor
questions.answer: Word processor is a software which allows to create, edit, print documents.

questions.question: What are the commonly use word processing softwares
questions.answer: Microsoft Word, OpenOffice Writer, Google Docs, LibreOffice Writer

questions.question: What are the features of word processing software
questions.answer: Creating, editing, saving and printing documents, Copying, pasting, moving and deleting text within a document, Formatting text, such as font type, bolding, underlining or italicizing, Creating and editing tables, Inserting elements from other software, such as illustrations or photographs

questions.question: What is the best way to create 100 letters with different names and addresses in an efficiently
questions.answer: Creating a mail merge document and making copies from it.

questions.question: What is the way of placing an image or a clip art behind the text without making interrupt
questions.answer: Placing the image as watermark image.

questions.question: What are the different types of letter cases in MS Word
questions.answer: Lower case, Upper case, Sentence case, Toggle case

questions.question: What are the different types of page orientations modes in MS Word
questions.answer: Portrait, Landscape

questions.question: How to style a document title in MS Word
questions.answer: By creating it as WordArt.

questions.question: How to create dummy text in word document
questions.answer: By typing '=Rand()'

questions.question: What is Microsoft Excel
questions.answer: Microsoft Excel is said to be a spreadsheet application or an electronic worksheet that is helpful for storing, analyzing data, manipulating data, and organizing reports.

questions.question: Provide the different types of data formats available in Excel
questions.answer: Accounting, Date, Percentage, Number, and Text are the different data formats available in Excel.

questions.question: Define Format Painter
questions.answer: If you want to copy the format of a cell, text, image etc and apply on another text, the Format painter is used.

questions.question: Define cells in Excel
questions.answer: The place where we store the data is called a cell.

questions.question: List out the charts available in MS Excel
questions.answer: Pie, Bar, Scatter, Line are some of the available charts in MS Excel, which is useful to provide graphical representation of a report/analysis.

questions.question: What is the function used to get the total of columns and rows in Excel
questions.answer: To get the total of columns and rows in Excel, use the function ‘SUM’.

questions.question: What is the use of ‘IF’ function in Excel
questions.answer: To verify whether the conditions are true or false, the function ‘IF’ is used in Excel.

questions.question: Give the advantage of Look Up function in Excel
questions.answer: To return a value for array, you can use the function Look Up.

questions.question: Provide the shortcut for find and replace
questions.answer: Ctrl+F is the shortcut key to open the find tab and Ctrl+H is the shortcut to open find and replace tab.

questions.question: To perform auto-sum on the rows and columns, what is the shortcut
questions.answer: ALT=’ is the shortcut to perform auto-sum on the rows and columns.

questions.question: Which power point view works best for adding slide transition
questions.answer: Slide sorter view

questions.question: Which option can be used to set custom timings for slides in a presentation
questions.answer: Rehearsal

questions.question: What PowerPoint feature will you use to apply motion effects to different objects of a slide
questions.answer: Animation Scheme

questions.question: What is the difference between Slide Design and Auto Content Wizard
questions.answer: Slide Design does not provide sample content but Auto Content Wizard provides sample content too.

questions.question: In which menu can you find features like Slide Design, Slide Layout etc.
questions.answer: Format Menu

questions.question: Which menu provides you options like Animation Scheme, custom Animation, Slide Transition
questions.answer: Slide Show Menu

questions.question: What is the short cut key to insert a new slide in current presentation
questions.answer: Ctrl+M

questions.question: What is the best way to create another copy of a slide
questions.answer: From Insert Menu choose Duplicate Slide.

questions.question: What happens if you edited an image inserted in PowerPoint
questions.answer: The original file that was inserted is not changed.

questions.question: In Microsoft PowerPoint, what are the two kinds of sound effects files that can be added to the presentation
questions.answer: .wave file, .mid file

questions.question: What is a motion path
questions.answer: A method of moving items on a slide.

questions.question: What is a slide-title master pair
questions.answer: A slide master and title master for a specific design template.

questions.question: What is the view that displays the slides on a presentation as miniature representations of the slides
questions.answer: Slide sorter view

questions.question: What is the PowerPoint view that displays only text
questions.answer: Outline view

questions.question: What is the shortcut key can be used to view slide show
questions.answer: F5

questions.question: What is a database
questions.answer:
A database is an organized collection of data, generally stored and accessed
electronically from a computer system.

questions.question: What is DBMS (Database Management System)
questions.answer:
A database management system (DBMS) is software for creating and managing
databases.

questions.question: What is primary key
questions.answer: Primary key is a unique identifier of a table.

questions.question: What is foreign key
questions.answer:
Foreign key is a primary key of another table which helps to make relationships
between tables.

questions.question: What is an entity
questions.answer:
An entity is something that exists separately from other things and has a clear
identity.

questions.question: What is an attribute
questions.answer: An attribute is a characteristic of an entity.

questions.question: What are the three basic relationship types use in DBMS
questions.answer: one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-many

questions.question: What is ERD (Entity Relationship Diagram)
questions.answer: Diagram for use in database design.

questions.question: What is SQL stands for
questions.answer: Structured Query Language

questions.question: What are the examples for DBMS
questions.answer: Microsoft Access, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle

questions.question: What is HTML stands for
questions.answer: Hyper Text Markup Language.

questions.question: What is static web page
questions.answer: A static Web page is a page that is built using HTML.

questions.question: What is dynamic web page
questions.answer:
A dynamic web page is a web page that displays different content each time it's
viewed.

questions.question: What are languages use to create dynamic web pages
questions.answer: JavaScript, DHTML, VBScript

questions.question: What is W3C stands for
questions.answer: World Wide Web Consortium.

questions.question: How the W3C relate with the WWW (World Wide Web)
questions.answer:
The World Wide Web Consortium is the main international standards
organization for the World Wide Web.

questions.question: What is CSS stands for
questions.answer: Cascading Style Sheets.

questions.question: What is hyperlink
questions.answer: A link from a hypertext document to another location.

questions.question: What is the rendering tool/software of HTML
questions.answer: Web browser/ Web Client

questions.question: What is a cookie in website
questions.answer: A small text file created by a website that is stored in the user's data.

questions.question: What is a website
questions.answer: A website is a collection of publicly accessible, interlinked Web pages.

questions.question: What is an attachment
questions.answer: An attachment, or email attachment, is a file sent with an email message.

questions.question: What are the Cc and Bcc in email
questions.answer: Cc - Carbon Copy, Bcc - Blind Carbon Copy

questions.question: How the Cc and Bcc differentiate?
questions.answer:
The difference between Cc and Bcc is that carbon copy (CC) recipients are
visible to all other recipients whereas those who are BCCed are not visible to anyone.

questions.question: What is search engine
questions.answer:
A web search engine is a web application that is designed to search for
information on the World Wide Web.

questions.question: What are the components of a computer system
questions.answer: Hardware, Software, Liveware, Firmware

questions.question: What are the components of CPU
questions.answer: ALU (Arithmetic logic unit), CU (Control unit), Registers

questions.question: What is FSB (Front Side Bus)
questions.answer: The Front Side Bus connects the CPU to main memory.

questions.question: What is BSB (Back Side Bus)
questions.answer: It connects the CPU to a Level 2 cache.

questions.question: What are the three types of cashe memories
questions.answer: Level 1, Level 2, Level 3

questions.question: What is primary memory in computer
questions.answer: RAM (Main Memory), ROM

questions.question: What is a volatile memory
questions.answer: RAM (Random Access Memory)

questions.question: What is a non-volatile memory
questions.answer: ROM (Read Only Memory)

questions.question: What is the different between volatile and non-volatile
questions.answer:
Volatile Memory is a type of memory in which data contained in the memory is
lost whenever the power is turned off. Non-volatile memory as once the user turns off
your computer then content remains intact and will not get lost.

questions.question: What is secondary memory in computer
questions.answer: Hard disk, Optical drives (CD/DVD-ROM), Flash drives (Pen drive)

questions.question: What is the port which supports multiple devices
questions.answer: USB port

questions.question: What is hot-swappable
questions.answer:
Hot-swappable means that you can plug in or remove a device without first
shutting down your computer.

questions.question: What is plug and play
questions.answer: Computer will recognize it as soon as it is installed.

questions.question: What are the four classifications of computers
questions.answer: Supercomputer, Mainframe Computer, Minicomputer, Microcomputer

questions.question: What are the types of operating systems
questions.answer: Real time OS, Single user-single task OS, Single user-multi task OS, Multi user-multi task OS

questions.question: What is BIOS (Basic Input/Output System)
questions.answer: The built-in program which controls the primary functions of a computer.

questions.question: What is computer a network
questions.answer:
A computer network is a set of computers connected together for the purpose
of sharing resources.

questions.question: What is network topology
questions.answer: Network topology refers to the physical or logical layout of a network.

questions.question: What are the basic network topologies
questions.answer: Bus, Star, Ring, Mesh

questions.question: What is the hybrid topology
questions.answer: Hybrid topology is an interconnection of two or more basic network topologies.

questions.question: What is the example for Hybrid topology
questions.answer: Tree topology

questions.question: What are the basic data transmission/communication modes
questions.answer: Simplex, Half-duplex, Full-duplex

questions.question: What are the data transmission/communication modes among network devices
questions.answer: Unicast, Multicast, Broadcast

questions.question: What are the two types of network architectures
questions.answer: Client-server architecture, Peer-to-peer architecture

questions.question: What is protocol
questions.answer:
A protocol is a set of rules that governs the communications between
computers on a network.

questions.question: What is IP stands for
questions.answer: Internet Protocol

questions.question: What is the use of IP address
questions.answer:
An IP address, or simply an "IP," is a unique address that identifies a device on
the Internet or a local network.

questions.question: What is the different between IP address and MAC (Media Access Control) address
questions.answer:
IP address is a logical address which can be changed. MAC address is a physical
address which cannot be changed.

questions.question: What are the different types of network
questions.answer:
PAN(Personal Area Network), LAN (Local Area Network), MAN(Metropolitan
Area Network), WAN(Wide Area Network)

questions.question: What are the basic protocols govern the network / internet
questions.answer: TCP (Transmission Control Protocol), IP (Internet Protocol)

questions.question: What is bandwidth
questions.answer: Maximum data transfer rate of a network or Internet connection.

questions.question: What are the unguided/unbound media
questions.answer: Radio wave, Micro wave, Infrared

questions.question: What are the guided/bound media
questions.answer: Coaxial, Twisted-Pair, Fiber optics

questions.question: What are the three basic requirements for data communication
questions.answer: Sender, Medium, Receiver

questions.question: What are the two types of conceptual models use in networking
questions.answer: OSI (Open System Interconnection) model, TCP/IP model

questions.question: Which are the layers of OSI model can be directly interacted with user
questions.answer:
Application Layer (Layer 7) – User Interfaces, Physical Layer (Layer 1) – Network
cables and hubs

questions.question: What is domain name
questions.answer: A domain name is simply a human readable form of an IP address.

questions.question: What is the use of DNS (Domain Name System)
questions.answer: Domain name to IP mapping is done by DNS

questions.question: What is the use of DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol)
questions.answer: DHCP is a protocol for assigning dynamic IP addresses to devices on a network.

questions.question: What are the two types of IP addresses
questions.answer: Static IP (Permanent IP), Dynamic IP (Temporary IP)

questions.question: What is the use of 'ipconfig' command in Windows
questions.answer: ipconfig' allows you to get the IP address information of a Windows computer.

questions.question: What is the use of 'ping' command
questions.answer:
ping' allows a user to verify that a particular IP address exists and can accept
requests.

questions.question: What is a pixel
questions.answer: Smallest unit of the digital image/display.

questions.question: What is pixel resolution
questions.answer: Total number of pixels of a digital image/display.

questions.question: How to measure resolution
questions.answer: Pixel per inch (ppi)

questions.question: What is vector graphics
questions.answer: Points and paths based graphics.

questions.question: What is raster graphic
questions.answer: Pixel based graphics.

questions.question: What are the primary/additive colors
questions.answer: Red, Green, Blue

questions.question: What are the secondary/subtractive/four/process colors
questions.answer: Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Black

questions.question: What is the application of primary colors
questions.answer: Digital displays / images.

questions.question: What is the application of secondary colors
questions.answer: Printing purposes.

questions.question: What are the suitable image file types for web
questions.answer: jpeg, png, gif

questions.question: What are the popular vector graphic softwares
questions.answer: Adobe Illustrator, Corel Draw

questions.question: What are the popular raster graphic softwares
questions.answer: Adobe Photoshop, GIMP

data.moduleName: Develop Graphics for Online / Print Media

questions.question: What is the relationship between HTML and CSS
questions.answer: CSS is used to style the HTML pages.

questions.question: Which tag is used to create hyperlink
questions.answer: Anchor tag ('a' tag)

questions.question: What is the meaning of empty tag
questions.answer: Empty tags does not contain attributes inside the tag.

questions.question: What is the meaning of self-closing tag
questions.answer: Self-closing tag does not include closing tag.

questions.question: What is the current version of HTML
questions.answer: Version 5

questions.question: What is the current version of CSS
questions.answer: Version 3

questions.question: What is the meaning of CSS framework
questions.answer: It is a complete package which helps to decorate HTML pages easily.

questions.question: What are the examples for CSS frameworks
questions.answer: Bootstrap, Foundation, Skeleton, Tailwind

questions.question: What are the tags that can be used to design the layout of a web page
questions.answer: div' Tag, 'table' Tag

questions.question: Who is the responsible person for manage a website in an organization
questions.answer: Web Administrator

questions.question: What is the advantage of dynamic web page
questions.answer: Dynamic web pages can generate different content according to the situation, user or session.

questions.question: What are the three types of including CSS to a web page
questions.answer: Inline, Internal, External

questions.question: What is the tag that can be used to create HTML animations
questions.answer: marquee' tag

questions.question: What are the examples for web programming languages
questions.answer: PHP, ASP.NET, JSP, JavaScript

questions.question: What are the requirements for publish a website
questions.answer: Hosting service, Domain name

questions.question: What is the importance of a domain name
questions.answer: Domain name can be used as an unique identifier for a particular website.

questions.question: When you upload your website to a hosting server, how to define your home page
questions.answer: The home page should be rename as 'index.html'

questions.question: What are the stages/phases of SDLS (System Development Life Cycle)
questions.answer: Planning, Analysis, Design, Implementation, Testing, Maintenance

questions.question: What are facts finding methods using in analysis phase
questions.answer:
Sampling of existing documentation, Research and Site visits, Observation of
the work environment, Questionnaires, Interviews, Prototyping, Joint requirements planning

questions.question: What is the output of analysis phase in SDLC
questions.answer: SRS (Software Requirements Specification) Document.

questions.question: What are the main two types of designing
questions.answer: Logical design, Physical design

questions.question: What is the different between logical and physical design
questions.answer:
Logical design represent the data flow of the system, physical design represent
the data storing (database) of the system.

questions.question: What is DFD stands for
questions.answer: Data Flow Diagram.

questions.question: What is the using of DFD
questions.answer: To represent the data flow of the system.

questions.question: What are the two types of programming approaches
questions.answer: Functional programming, Object oriented programming (OOP)

questions.question: What are the three types of control structures/control construct
questions.answer: Sequential, Selection/Conditional, Looping/Iteration/Repeating

questions.question: What are the commonly use programming languages
questions.answer: Java, Python, PHP, JavaScript, Visual Basic, C#

questions.question: What is the different between compiler and interpreter
questions.answer:
Compiler converts the whole program in one goes on the other hand.
Interpreter converts the program by taking a single line at a time.

questions.question: What is the different between high level languages and low level languages
questions.answer:
Low level language is machine readable form of program. High level language
will be in human readable form.

questions.question: What are the examples for high level programming languages
questions.answer: Java, Python, PHP, JavaScript, Visual Basic, C#

questions.question: What are the examples for low level programming languages
questions.answer: Machine code, Assembly language

questions.question: What is the term called “bug” in programming
questions.answer: A software bug is an error, flaw, failure or fault in a computer program.

questions.question: What is the meaning of debug
questions.answer:
The process of identifying and removing errors from computer hardware or
software.

questions.question: What is the meaning of “Source code”
questions.answer:
Source code is the set of instructions and statements written by a programmer
using a computer programming language.

questions.question: What are the main types of software testing methods
questions.answer: Black box testing, White box testing, Gray box testing

questions.question: What is the meaning of unit testing
questions.answer: Testing the smallest part of individual unit / component of the system.

questions.question: What is the meaning of integration testing
questions.answer: Program units are combined and testing as groups.

questions.question: What is the meaning of system testing
questions.answer: System testing is done after integration testing, testing the system as a whole.

questions.question: What is the meaning of acceptance testing
questions.answer: Last phase of the software testing process. A system is tested for acceptability.
